Original integral
$$\phi_p^a(t) = \frac{1}{\tau}\int_0^t \phi_p(t')e^{-(t-t')/\tau} \, dt'$$
Using Leibniz rule
$$\partial_t \phi^a_p (t)= \frac{1}{\tau}\left(\phi_p(t)+\int ^t_0 -\phi_p(t')\frac{e^{-(t-t')/\tau}}{\tau}\right)$$
$$\partial_t \phi^a_p (t)= \frac{1}{\tau}\left(\phi_p(t)-\phi_p^a(t)\right)$$
$$\tau \partial_t \phi^a_p (t)= -\phi_p^a(t) + \phi_p(t)$$

# Andriy
$$\phi_p = \phi_p^a + \phi_p^p$$
$$\tau \partial_t \phi^a_p (t)= Diffusi-\phi_p^a(t) + \phi_p^p(t)^n\phi_G$$
$$\tau \partial_t \phi^a_p (t)= -\phi_p^a(t) + (\phi_p-\phi_p^a)^n\phi_G$$
